clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction Model for Multiple Pulmonary Nodules
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction Model for Multiple Pulmonary Nodules

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the sensitivity, specificity and accuracy of radiologists, thoracic surgeons and a predictive model (PKUM model) to discriminate malignancy from benign nodules in patients with multiple pulmonary nodules.

detailed_description.textblock: It is clinically difficult to diagnose and manage patients with multiple pulmonary nodules (MPNs). We have developed a web-based mathematic model (PKUM model) by using a multi-centric database from three institutions (Peking University People's Hospital, Haidian Section of Peking University Third Hospital, People's Hospital Affiliated to Hebei Medical University) to predict the probability of a nodule to be malignant in patients with MPNs. This prospectively observational study will recruit patients with MPNs between January 2019 and March 2019, allowing radiologists, surgeons, and a predictive model (PKUM model) to discriminate malignancy from benign nodules, and compare their sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy.

primary_outcome.description: Area under receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC) of PKUM model in predicting the probability of a nodule to be malignant in patients with multiple pulmonary nodules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison between PKUM model and clinicians
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of sensitivity and specificity of radiologists, thoracic surgeons, and PKUM model in predicting the probability of a nodule to be malignant in patients with multiple pulmonary nodules.

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance of PKUM model in equivocal nodules which is difficult to judge by clinicians
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of PKUM model in predicting malignant probability of equivocal nodules judged by radiologists and thoracic surgeons.

study_pop.textblock: The population include patients with multiple pulmonary nodules who will be diagnosed and treated between January 1，2019 and March 30, 2019. Patients with at least 2 nodules resected will be enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with newly discovered, 4-30 mm multiple pulmonary nodules shown on thoracic CT scans
- Patients with at least two nodules resected for pathological evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of malignancy within 5 years
- Presence of pneumonia or pleural effusion on thoracic CT scans
- Patients with none or only one nodule resected
- Patients with initial chemo-radiation therapy
